frontMatter.title: Confirmation
frontMatter.description: Template providing users with essential information following successful form submission.
frontMatter.intro: The form confirmation page provides users with essential information following their submission of an online application, including what to expect next, a benefit summary, confirmation number, and submission date.

when_to_use.value: **Successful submission.** After users successfully submit an online form or application.
**Confirm receipt.** To confirm receipt and provide next steps.
**Record keeping.** To help users retain records of their submission.

structure.intro: The confirmation page provides essential post-submission information and record-keeping options.

sections.title: Page Title (H1)
sections.description: Carries over from the original form.

sections.description: Enables users to save/print submission records.

sections.title: Success Alert
sections.description: Confirms successful submission with relevant details including date and confirmation number.

sections.title: Data Accordion

content_guidelines.value: **Success alert example.** 'Form submission started on [date]. Your submission is in progress. It can take up to 30 days for us to receive your form.'
**Address key questions.** What happens after submission? Processing timeline? Required actions while waiting? How to get help? Will VA request more information?
Research shows 30.55% print page for records, 27.35% download form copy, 27.03% check status on My VA.
A 2024 study found that a majority of Veterans indicated they would download a copy of their form submission.

accessibility.value: Ensure content fills 100% of print width.
Follow form accessibility guidelines for all content.
Success alerts should be announced to screen readers.
